page.title: 08LEISURE IN CORBY.
page.content: On Tuesday nights during term time there is a Youth Club in school for the lower school, and one for seniors on Thursdays. Lots of pupils go because there are not many things to do at night. If it is cold and rainy you can't just walk around the streets. Not many can afford the 90p for an hour at the Sports centre, so the 20p for club is cheap. Parents and teachers provide table tennis, bar billiards, badminton, games such as chess and telvision, and a tuck shop. We could do with more clubs Most nights there is a Boys' Club next to Woodnewton Way school but the discos on Wednesdays cause a lot of fights so a lot of rough boys gather there. Other nights it starts late because Cubs meet there, but they have only a snooker & pool table.There are not many things for young people to do at night except walk the streets.
